intro: Hegemone micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered hedysarum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system forms nodules that host nitrogen-fixing bacteria, contributing to soil fertility. Hegemone micrantha is often found in the understory of forests, where it thrives in partial shade.
